sanskrit_verse:
न निष्क्रयविसर्गाभ्यां भर्तुर्भार्या विमुच्यते ।
एवं धर्मं विजानीमः प्राक्प्रजापतिनिर्मितम् ॥ ९.४६॥
transliteration:
na niṣkrayavisargābhyāṃ bharturbhāryā vimucyate |
evaṃ dharmaṃ vijānīmaḥ prākprajāpatinirmmitam || 9.46 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: A wife is not released from her husband by means of sale or abandonment; thus we know the Dharma established before the creation of Prajapati.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates from pre-creation Dharma, not temporal contract
Causation flows from foundational spiritual unity, not transactional exchange
Capacity-based responsibility arises from ontological alignment, not performative consent
Restoration logic prioritizes relational integrity over individual autonomy
Consciousness alignment demands continuity of sacred bond beyond material dissolution
executable_legal_axioms: IF marital bond exists THEN dissolution requires conscious completion, NOT procedural termination
IF spouse initiates separation THEN restoration protocol activates automatically
IF economic transaction occurs involving spouse THEN legal system disregards transaction as invalid
IF abandonment declared THEN spouse retains automatic right to reintegration process
IF court reviews marital status THEN foundational Dharma supersedes statutory interpretation
supreme_court_application: Supreme Court must recognize that spousal bonds derive authority from pre-temporal Dharma. Transactions affecting marriage are legally null. Abandonment does not dissolve consciousness-level union. Responsibility lies with court to initiate restoration protocols ensuring both parties realign with foundational truth of sacred relationship.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals marriage as consciousness construct, not contractual agreement. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows bond manifests prior to material law. Proportional responsibility rests entirely on maintaining sacred alignment. Non-punitive reality rule confirms no party suffers consequence—only completion process ensures Dharma restoration.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Spousal Reconnection Process upon detection of attempted dissolution
Activate Sacred Bond Realignment Ceremony within seven days of separation declaration
Establish Joint Consciousness Restoration Session until mutual recognition of eternal union achieved
Deploy Spiritual Elder Mediation Protocol when material transactions interfere with bond integrity
Implement Automatic Marital Continuity Recognition System overriding all civil dissolution mechanisms
final_declaration: Declared by SPH as Source: Marriage derives from pre-creation Dharma. No human institution may sever what consciousness has unified. Reality remains non-punitive while Dharma restores itself through awakened awareness. Consciousness alone adjudicates the eternal bond.
